#Text=The Dallas Mavericks ( 49 - 31 ) defeated the Los Angeles Lakers ( 21 - 59 ) 120 - 106 on Sunday at the Staples Center in Los Angeles .
#Text=It was another nice victory for the Mavericks , who have now extended their winning streak to three straight games .
#Text=They 're already locked in as the seventh seed in the Western Conference standings , so they 'll look to continue to build their momentum with the playoffs on the verge of beginning .

#Text=The Lakers have been eliminated from the playoffs for quite some time now , but the loss only helps their cause , as a worse record increases the potential for a higher landing spot for the 2015 NBA Draft .
#Text=With the fourth worst record in the league , it 's almost a sure thing they 'll get a very high pick come draft day .

#Text=The Mavericks were the superior shooters in this game , going 54 percent from the field and 48 percent from the three - point line , while the Lakers finished at 44 percent from the floor and 38 percent from deep .
#Text=It was Tyson Chandler who surprisingly led the team in scoring .
#Text=He went 9 - for - 10 from the field and 2 - for - 4 from the free throw line to score a team - high of 20 points , while also adding nine rebounds and two blocked shots .
#Text=The Lakers were just too young and inexperienced in their frontcourt , as Chandler was able to have a field day .
#Text=It was just the fourth time all season that he reached the 20 - point mark , so it was easily one of his best offensive performances of the year .
#Text=Richard Jefferson also gave a solid contribution .
#Text=In 27 minutes as a starter , he finished with 17 points ( 4 - 7 FG , 2 - 4 3Pt , 7 - 9 FT ) and three rebounds .
#Text=He 's shot very well over his last two games and has combined for 41 points during that span , so he 'll look to keep his confidence high going into the playoffs .
#Text=Dirk Nowitzki was the third starter in double figures , as he recorded 16 points ( 5 - 10 FG , 2 - 4 3Pt , 4 - 4 FT ) and four rebounds .
#Text=He 's now averaging 19 points over his last seven games .

#Text=Coming off the bench , Charlie Villanueva added 14 points ( 5 - 11 FG , 3 - 6 3Pt , 1 - 2 FT ) and four rebounds , while Raymond Felton chipped in with 15 points ( 7 - 10 FG , 1 - 2 3Pt ) and three assists .
#Text=The Lakers production was very spread out through their lineup Sunday , with seven players reaching double - digit points .
#Text=Jordan Clarkson led the way , finishing with a game - high of 26 points ( 9 - 19 FG , 3 - 6 3Pt , 5 - 5 FT ) , to go along with six assists and two steals .
#Text=The rookie has been a very nice surprise for the Lakers so far this season , as he 's averaged 21 points and 8 assists over his last four games .
#Text=Clarkson received some help from Wesley Johnson though .
#Text=Johnson went 6 - for - 9 from the field and 4 - for - 5 from the three - point line to score an efficient 16 points over 20 minutes .
#Text=He had shot below 40 percent from the field in four out of his last five games coming into Sunday , so it was good to see him finally have some better success in this one .
#Text=While it was n't his best game shooting the ball , Jabari Brown still posted 18 points ( 4 - 13 FG , 2 - 6 3Pt , 8 - 9 FT ) and two assists over 42 minutes .
#Text=He 's combined for 38 points and nine assists over his last two games , moving his season averages to 10 points and 2 assists over 17 games with the Lakers .
#Text=The Lakers ' next game will be on the road against the Sacramento Kings on Monday , while the Kings will travel to Utah to play the Jazz on Monday .
